titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Morton Feldman Collection of Audio Recordings, circa 1966-1993
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2013. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, February 2013.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard ).

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Morton Feldman Collection of Audio Recordings, circa 1966-1993
did.physdesc: 6 boxes ( 87 audio recordings (52 reel to reel tapes, 35 cassettes) (97 compact discs)) (5 linear feet)
did.materialspec: The contents were digitally reformatted. The preservation files were created as WAV files at 96kHZ/24bit resolution. The service copies exist as CD audio files and as WAV files at 44kHZ/24bit resolution.
did.langmaterial: Some spoken word content in English.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The Morton Feldman Collection of Audio Recordings contains 52 reel to reel tapes and 35 cassette recordings, including performances of 38 compositions by Morton Feldman. The collection also includes some events, including the conversations between John Cage and Feldman recorded in 1966 as Radio Happenings I and II, the memorial service for Feldman at St. Mark's Church in New York City, a tribute radio program broadcast by WNYC 7 November 1987 in New York City, and an interview of Jan Williams by Sebastian Claren about Feldman. Other composers represented by recordings include Harrison Birtwistle, Pierre Boulez, John Cage, Barbara Monk Feldman, and Bunita Marcus.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Morton Feldman Collection of Audio Recordings, circa 1966-1993, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: The original recordings were made on reel-to-reel tapes and cassettes. The contents were digitized in 2013 onto a hard drive with service copies on CDs. Preservation wav files that match the original reel faces are named with roots that match the tape numbering. For example preservation files for the first tape are named ubmu0002_2_01.wav. The CD audio tracks match the contents of the original sources, one track per musical work. Wav files were created from the CD audio and are named using the work numbers listed in the container list with the addition of the suffix "sc" for service copy. Preservation and service audio files are stored in the Institutional Repository.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Composer Morton Feldman (1926-1987) was best known for his association with the New York School of experimentalist musicians, including composers John Cage, Christian Wolff, and Earle Brown, and pianist David Tudor. In addition to composing approximately 150 works, Feldman also wrote more than three dozen articles about various aspects of music and art.

Feldman was a member of the music department faculty at the State University of New York at Buffalo from 1972-1987. During those years he served as Slee Professor of Music 1972-1973, Edgar Varèse Professor 1975-1987, and Director of the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts, 1976-1980. He was also responsible for creating the June in Buffalo festival of contemporary music in 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Morton Feldman Collection of Audio Recordings contains 52 reel to reel tapes and 35 cassette recordings that were in Feldman's personal collection. They contain performances of 38 compositions by Morton Feldman. Most of the recordings have never been issued commercially. The collection also includes some events, including the conversations between John Cage and Feldman recorded in 1966 as Radio Happenings I and II, the memorial service for Feldman at St. Mark's Church in New York City, a tribute radio program broadcast by WNYC 7 November 1987 in New York City, and an interview of Jan Williams by Sebastian Claren about Feldman. Other composers represented by recordings include Harrison Birtwistle, Pierre Boulez, John Cage, Barbara Monk Feldman, and Bunita Marcus.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:

did.unittitle: Reel to reel tapes, circa 1966-1993

arrangement.p:
Arranged in three subseries:
I.A. Reel to reel tapes of compositions by Morton Feldman
I.B. Reel to reel tapes of events with Morton Feldman
I.C. Reel to reel tapes of compositions by other composers

list.head: Work number: ubmu0002_2_76_01--ubmu0002_2_77_01
list.item: WNYC radio show tribute to Morton Feldman, part 1-2

Includes performance of Feldman's Oboe and orchestra, Palais de Marais (performed by Bunita Marcus), comments by William Colleran, recordings of Artur Rubinstein performing Chopin mazurkas, and a recording of the second movement of a Sibelius symphony.

did.unittitle: Morton Feldman Collection of Audio Recordings Tape 78, 16 June 1993

note.p: "The interview took place on Wednesday 16 June 1993 at 4 P.M. in the Buffalo, New York home of Jan Williams (only the first 45 minutes were recorded on tape). Among other things, Williams indicates when Feldman began to collect rugs."

list.head: Work number: ubmu0002_2_77_01
list.item: Interview of Jan Williams by Sebastian Claren on subject of Morton Feldman

The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Morton Feldman Papers, 1950-1999 Mus. Arc. 2.1
defitem.item: The Morton Feldman Papers comprise personal and business correspondence, writings by and about Feldman, clippings, programs, and photographs.

defitem.label: C. F. Peters Collection of Morton Feldman Manuscripts, 1961-1969 Mus. Arc. 2.4
defitem.item: The collection consists of 79 works by Morton Feldman in either score or part formats (72 scores; 7 sets of parts). All but one item are ink manuscripts on vellum. These served as the masters that Feldman submitted to C. F. Peters and Peters published directly from these masters.
